Description: Oak panel bearing tempera portrait of bearded man wearing white tunic with purple clavi.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Kom el-Kharaba el-Kebir (Previously recorded as Rubaiyat)
Curator's comments: Published: S. Walker and M. Bierbrier, Fayum. Misteriosi volti dall'Egitto, London 1997, p. 113 [82].
Bibliographic references: Badawy 1978 / Coptic art and archaeology (4.11, p.239)
Exhibition history: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces 2021 13 Feb-15 Aug, Belgium, Tongeren, Gallo-Romeins Museum, 'Rome; City & Empire' 2021-2022 25 Sep – 08 Oct, China, Suzhou Museum, 'Rome: City & Empire'
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Robert Ludwig Mond
